duck: Tap Roots, a 1948 film starring Van Heflin
Taproot - A taproot is an enlarged, somewhat straight to tapering plant root that grows downward.
taproot definition: a primary root that grows vertically downward and gives off small lateral roots.

taproot, shown with the plant.]]
s.]] A 'taproot' is an enlarged, somewhat straight to tapering plant root that
  grows downward. It forms a center from which other roots sprout laterally.<ref>[http://www.hcs.ohio-
  state.edu/mg/manual/botany.htm Botany Manual: Ohio State University]</ref>
  Plants with taproots are difficult to transplant. The presence of a taproot is
  why dandelions are hard to uprootâ€”the top is pulled, but the long taproot
  stays in the ground, and resprouts.

The 'taproot system' contrasts with the fibrous root system with many
branched roots.
wiki.title: taproot
